Job description

Reporting to the Warehouse Supervisor, UGL has an opening for Warehouse Storeperson to join our team at Spotswood.

The purpose of this role is to carry out assigned warehouse duties including correct receipting, storage and distribution of product to support operations at the SMC rail maintenance facility.




About The Role
  • Receipting, ensure quality checking of product coming in to the facility from outside vendors,
  • Safe and productive storage of parts within the main warehouse, sub-warehouse and outside storage areas,
  • When required, unloading and loading of trucks when stock arrives and being sent to outside vendors,
  • Pick required parts for service technicians, as required and for future requirements,
  • Preparation of parts for service kits,
  • Participate in stocktaking and cycle counts when directed by warehouse supervisor,
  • Carry out processing on UGL inventory management systems, i.e. the issuing of consumed parts, receipting of UX parts, processing of rotable parts and entering of stock take and cycle count data,
  • Ensure compliance with all record keeping requirements.
  • Undertake any adhoc projects, initiatives, tasks as directed by the Warehouse Supervisor.
  • Ensure compliance with all record keeping requirements.


About You
  • Forklift LF Qualifications, practical experience in operating of counterbalance and high reach forklift in warehouse and yard facility
  • Current Victorian car license
  • Strong communication skills. Both oral and written
  • Proficient skills in computers: MS Word, Excel, email and SAP warehouse inventory systems

What We Offer
  • Full time employment
  • Competitive remuneration package
  • Diverse opportunities to grow, back yourself and achieve
  • A chance to join a 6,000+ strong organisation owned by the CIMIC Group, one of the world’s leading international contractors

What Makes You Right For UGL
  • Genuine concern for safety
  • Capacity to flourish in a high-performance environment
  • An innovative mindset and a willingness to challenge the norm
  • You believe success and value are driven by real teams where everyone has a role to play

About Us

UGL is a diversified services company delivering critical assets and essential services that sustain and enhance the environment in which we live. Our capabilities extend across a broad range of services and whole-of-life solutions for diverse industries, utilising world leading, sustainable and innovative technologies. We partner with some of the world’s largest blue-chip companies, government agencies, private enterprise, and public institutions.

As a diversified services organisation, UGL appreciates the diversity and richness of its people, and seeks to create inclusive environments that promote your talent and skills.

If you are confident you have the skills and knowledge to fulfil this role, then please apply now via the button.

Junior Product Designer

Company Name Moose Toys Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 312 views

Job description

Moose Toys exists to make children happy. The team has innovation in their DNA and are famous for the design, development and manufacture of award winning toys that continue to disrupt the market!

Moose Toys dominates in categories including collectables, craft, dolls, games and youth electronics featuring much loved brands such as: Shopkins, Little Live Pets, Beados, Happy Places, The Grossery Gang, The Trash Pack and Mighty Beanz and is consistently recognised as the most creative company in the industry.

Moose Toys calls Australia home and has teams across Los Angeles, Hong Kong, China, London, Paris and Vietnam, employing more than 350+ staff and distributing to over 100 countries.

Today, Moose Toys is on the hunt for a Junior Product Designer!

Role Objective

You will be responsible for assisting the Product Design team with the progression of an idea from concept to realisation. This includes both design and administrative tasks to resolve product detailing, CAD models, physical mock-ups, compiling specification packages, product testing, sample purchasing, reviewing and commenting on product pilots, and other daily tasks overseen by the Product Designers.

Key Capabilities

Applying Expertise and Technical Capability: Has the functional and technical knowledge and skill to do the job well.
  • A basic understanding of plastic manufacturing processes:
  • Manufacture / tooling / moulding of plastic parts
  • Production line processes
  • Basic QA
  • Printing processes
  • Understanding of a range of materials and their characteristics;
  • Basic model making skills and an ability to think in 3D;
  • Strong sketching skills;
  • Excellent computer skills with preferred knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, Solidworks;
  • Create basic CAD models and digital renders;
  • Create physical mock-ups and proof of concept models, including overseeing 3D printing of models and machine maintenance.

    • Creating and Innovating: Open to new ideas and experiences; Seeks out learning opportunities; Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity.

    Presenting and Communicating with Impact: Communicates for impact, clarity and connection. Speaks fluently; expresses opinions, information and key points clearly; promotes ideas on behalf of oneself and others.

    Responsibilities

    Product Development
    • In collaboration with the Product Designers, assist in the development of approved product concepts through the key development stages;
    • Create technical specification packages, including product model specifications and written document specifications;
    • Coordinate reference and order samples as required;
    • Populate comment documents lead by Product Designers, including sketched and written comments;
    • Solve design issues regarding form, configuration of internal components and general appearance, incorporating feedback from the Product Design team;
    • Follow electronic and physical internal filing operating procedures;
    • Assist Marketing team with presentation material and samples for TV ads, toy fairs and external presentations.

    Market Research
    • Ensure product positioning in the market reflects current toy trends;
    • Travel to toy stores / other stores to collect samples and product reference as required for the Product Design team;
    • Overseeing and managing a growing Reference Product sample and Material Reference sample library;
    • Actively research the market place, other toy companies, vendors and trade fairs for trends, ideas, samples and information that will lead to and support new ideas for products and brand extensions.
    • Some overseas travel may be required where necessary.

    If this role sounds like you APPLY today!

    A relevant tertiary qualification e.g. Product / Industrial Design Degree

About Casey


The City of Casey is an ambitious, innovative and customer-focussed Council driven by our vision of 'creating Australia's most liveable city'. As the largest and one of the fastest growing municipalities in Victoria, Council plans and delivers quality services and infrastructure for the more than 314,000 residents who call Casey home.


The organisation recently moved into Bunjil Place, offering staff a modern, flexible and collaborative working environment as we strive to shape the future of Casey and deliver the most efficient and customer-centric services for our community.


The Role

Nurse Unit Manager- PACU and Anaesthetics

Company Name Epworth Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Exciting Leadership Role
  • Attractive benefits including salary packaging
  • Located in East Melbourne, close to Melbourne CBD and public transport

Epworth Freemasons

The Epworth Freemasons Hospital provides a world-class health service. As one of Victoria's leading maternity hospitals, Epworth Freemasons specialises in women’s health services including obstetrics, gynaecological and breast surgery. Epworth Freemasons also provides comprehensive cancer care, along with a full range of surgical services, including the latest robotic assisted surgery, orthopaedics and ICU care.

It is an exciting time to join Epworth Freemasons, having only recently been upgraded we have commenced a major redevelopment that will represent a generational change for our Clarendon Street hospital with construction underway to provide more consulting suites, operating theatres and improvements to patient amenity.

We are constructing a 12-level tower and buildings that will link to create significant onsite consulting opportunities for specialists, additional state-of-the-art theatres, expanded oncology services and extensive underground on-site car parking. We are also upgrading our maternity service facilities at our Victoria Parade campus in 2018.

The Role

Epworth Freemasons has a dynamic theatre complex, with 16 theatres, DOSA, Recovery and CSSD units across three sites, Clarendon Street, Victoria Parade and Cliveden.

We are seeking an experienced and talented Nurse Unit Manager to join the management team at Epworth Freemasons Clarendon Street to lead the PACU and Anaesthetics team. This role involves overseeing the operational needs of our 8 theatres and recovery unit. With plans to expand with an additional 4 theatres and additional recovery unit in the future, this is a unique opportunity to lead the team through redevelopment and growth.

If you are seeking career progression and you can bring expert clinical knowledge in a theatre setting, innovation management skills and the ability to lead change and inspire your team to be their best and give their best every day we want to hear from you.

Key areas of focus for this role include-
  • Delivering an exceptional patient experience within Perioperative services
  • Responsible for providing clinical leadership to the PACU/Anaesthetic department to compliment the strategic vision, operational processes and quality and safety of all patients.
  • Accountable and responsible for the effective daily management of our people, financial and material resources.


Skills & Experience

To be successful in this role you will have-
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
  • Demonstrated leadership skills
  • A demonstrated quality and risk focused approach to decision making
  • Current nursing registration with APHRA
  • Extensive, (eg. 5 plus) years’ experience in Anaesthetics/PACU nursing


About Epworth

Relevant Post Graduate qualifications are desirable.

Epworth HealthCare is a world-class, not-for-profit, private health care group dedicated to providing the best possible outcomes for our patients by providing the best possible care. Across our eight locations patients and staff have access to state-of-the-art diagnostic, surgical and procedural technology, world-class theatres and equipment and benefit from the extensive teaching and research occurring at Epworth every day.

The Epworth Difference is defined by our unique culture and dedication to giving outstanding patient care. From the way we recognise and reward our staff to our attitude toward the patient experience, Epworth is for those with the ambition to get better, give the best possible care and lead their field.

Epworth is a great choice for staff who want to be part of a cutting-edge, fast paced and progressive environment.

Enquire/Apply for this Position

To obtain more information refer to the attached position description.

Direct your enquiries to the contact person listed below.

Applications must be submitted online – to apply for this position click Apply Now

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Epworth and a valid employee Working with Children Check to be provided by the applicant.

854225432:

Process Engineer

Company Name Viva Energy Australia Pty Ltd Company Location Geelong, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 238 views

Job description

What’s in it for you?


Joining our successful business has many rewards. We offer a technically complex and challenging environment, a role that provides opportunity to play an important role in developing and designing process improvements. You will be enhancing profitability, reliability and safety at our Refinery. We offer the opportunity to work in an innovative environment, Viva Energy has been enjoying success and excited about moving from a private entity to an ASX 100 listed company. We pay super contributions at a higher rate, you’ll be able to build on your long-term security and you will also be supported with flexibility and above market parental leave provisions. There are other great benefits too, including 25 percent discount every time you fill up with Shell fuel. Our Geelong Refinery is occupying 120 hectares of land adjacent to Corio Bay in Geelong, Victoria. With more than $300 million invested in our operations since 2015, we’re making a strong commitment to keeping local manufacturing in Geelong.


About the role


You will work collaboratively as part of the refining team to maximise the long-term profitability of the Refinery. You will be involved in developing and designing process improvements enhancing profitability, reliability and safety. \xa0 In this role you will drive and support continuous improvement, product quality, cost, energy efficiency, production and margin for your area. You will drive the selection of operating modes, Lead and participate in investigations into sub optimal operation and provide solutions to prevent recurrence. You will provide support across Economics and Scheduling, Refinery Projects and Turnarounds.


About you


You will hold an engineering qualification, have familiarity with a major hazard facility (refinery or heavy industry operations). You will be highly analytical; you will have demonstrated technical engineering skills, excellent organisational and communication skills. You will have IT skills across Process simulation software and Plant data extract tools, as well as Excel and Word. We are seeking curious individuals, motivated to innovate and solve problems in a more cost effective manner than the obvious or traditional methods. Your curiosity will see you focused on safety, driving change and innovation. You will be comfortable influencing through others, engaging stakeholder across all levels and leading change. You will be experienced in identifying areas for improvement and working with technical areas outside of your expertise, making key decisions to improve the reliability and integrity of the refinery.


About us


\xa0We are the exclusive licensee of Shell fuels and distributor of Shell lubricants in Australia.


\xa0Viva Energy Australia is one of this country’s largest and most successful energy companies, with operations right across the continent. We’re proud to be Australian, proud of our 110-year history, and extremely proud of our achievements as we strive to become Australia’s most respected energy company.


\xa0Australia relies on Viva Energy. We supply around 25% of Australia’s fuel, refuelling 4.4 million trucks, buses, cars and motorcycles, as well as 1,000 ships and 350,000 planes each year. Today we have the capacity to store 2 billion litres of crude and refined product, and we continue to invest significantly in our business to make our local operations even stronger. Over 1,700 people choose to work with us. We inject about $1 billion into the national economy each year through wages and services.


\xa0Viva Energy makes, imports and delivers the fuels, lubricants, chemicals and bitumen Australians rely on to reach their destinations. We’re with workers on their daily commute. We’re with families on their school run and truck drivers moving freight across the country. We’re with machinery operators in the mining industry and help fuel the aviation and marine industries, playing our part to keep Australia moving.

Project Manager

Company Name BAE Systems Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 289 views

Job description

  • Enjoy friendly work practices, strong team culture and interesting work at a global company
  • Permanent and full time Project Manager position
  • Williamstown, Victoria or Sydney CBD location

\xa0

BAE Systems Australia is a global Defence and security company with wide-ranging products and services to support and protect Australia’s Defence forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology, and support services.

\xa0

We are seeking to appoint a dedicated Project Manager to make a valuable contribution to the Project Management Office (PMO). Reporting to the Manager - Project Management Office Maritime, this key position will be offered on a permanent and full time basis and can be situated at either our Williamstown, Victoria location or our Sydney CBD location. The purpose of this role is to support the application of project management within the Maritime business, provide greater operational support to the foundational project managers to develop capability, and improve the engagement with the project management community.

\xa0

As the Project Manager, you will:

  • Support the continuous improvement of project delivery and bids by providing support, coaching, reviewing and assisting small to medium projects or discrete domains

  • Be the operational interface and engage with the non-executive project managers

  • Support the development of project management personnel through the delivery of internal training, coaching, and mentoring

  • Maintain the project management resource profile within the Maritime business and support operational resourcing as the project manager representative at functional resourcing meetings

  • Manage the development and the deployment of discrete elements of the project management framework

  • Collaborate with business units and other functions, in definition of project assurance requirements, and the implementation of audit and other recommended improvements

  • Build and maintain positive customer and internal relationships

  • Provide leadership for project management initiatives, as well as being a role model of professional behaviour

  • Support assignments, as requested by the Head of Project Management or PMO Manager \xa0

\xa0

As an ideal applicant you will have:

  • Extensive project management experience

  • A relevant qualification

  • Strong communication, leadership and motivational skills, with a high level of self-motivation

  • The ability to negotiate with and influence internal and external stakeholders in a way which generates business benefit whilst maintaining key relationships

    \xa0

    As Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearance.

    \xa0

    International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) are applicable and as such, your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.

    \xa0

Applications should be addressed to: Kon Yiannikopoulos, Recruitment Specialist.

\xa0

Please ensure you attach a current resume and copy of your relevant qualification(s) to your application. A cover letter is preferred.

\xa0

At BAE Systems, we have a strong safety, health and environmental culture; employee safety and well-being is a top priority. We also maintain a genuine commitment to diversity and inclusion and to training and development, offer competitive benefits and enjoy a family friendly work place with flexible work practices.

\xa0

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

\xa0

To learn about other employment opportunities at BAE Systems, please visit: BAE Systems Careers Australia

\xa0

BAE Systems Australia employees are encouraged to refer others for employment in line with the conditions of the Employee Referral Scheme.

\xa0

Further information regarding clearances is available at: https://careers.au.baesystems.com/opportunity.html

\xa0

\xa0

Corporate Accountant

Company Name Elabor8 Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 174 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Role


The role of Corporate Accountant is required to maintain Elabor8’s financial records in compliance with laws, regulations and business policies. This involves performing or overseeing our general accounting operations by controlling and verifying all financial transactions, assisting the Financial Controller with management and other ad hoc reporting, and supporting tax, audit and compliance activity with Elabor8’s external advisors and regulators.

The Corporate Accountant role has primary responsibility for ensuring the following business functions are executed to a high standard of quality, either directly or through the supervision of the Finance Assistant.


This role will see the successful candidate involved in a diverse range of activities, amongst other things;


  • Monthly financial reporting - preparation of end of month journals, close off accounts, review Balance Sheets and Profit & Loss;
  • Responsible for the month end closure of the corporate head office including property expense accounting for the group's brands;
  • Prepare monthly payroll tax and superannuation reconciliation, quarterly BAS preparation, yearly FBT return;
  • Assist in the preparation of statutory accounts and year-end audit;
  • Assist in intercompany accounting and compliance with transfer pricing regulations;
  • Ensure SOX compliance and internal controls;
  • Process Improvement - continually challenge the processes and systems in place. Write up procedures and processes;
  • Business Unit Support - provide BUs with ad-hoc support and assistance as required;
  • Review the work of the Finance Assistant to ensure that work is compliant with internal process and policy.


What will you need to succeed?


  • Experience working in a similar Corporate Accountant position or as a Financial Accountant;
  • Qualified CA / CPA;
  • Demonstrated capacity to utilise Xero Accounting Software;
  • Knowledge of Workflow Max, Bamboo and Expensify - desirable;
  • Strong computer skills with advanced Excel;
  • Have solid written and verbal communication skills;
  • Possess a strong sense of responsibility, initiative and attention to detail;
  • Operate with a high degree of autonomy in line with policies and procedures;
  • Ability to manage competing priorities.


What we offer


  • We have invested a great deal of time in developing career paths for our people and can help guide your career;

[

Data Scientist Consultant

Company Name Big Cloud Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 99 views

Job description

Are you passionate about the advancement of AI? Are you a creative, bright Data Scientist with deep commercial understanding? Are you able to translate complex business problems into simple solutions?>


A highly successful tech start-up with offices in New York, London Singapore, Sydney and Melbourne. They implement a proprietary AI-powered research engine, capable of finding extremely complex patterns in data. This is an award-winning and ground-breaking solution, being used by Fortune 500 companies in many different sectors.


The company is in continual growth, and looking to add 4 new members to the Australia office.


\xa0What will you do? \xa0\xa0


  • Use data to solve various business problems and make an impact in\xa0multiple industries (Financial Risk, Health, \xa0Ecommerce, Marketing, Oil & Gas Exploration and more.).
  • Translate complex data into meaningful insights; deliver these in a way that the client understands.
  • Communicate directly with partners home and abroad.
  • Leverage client-side Data Science teams, helping them optimize their use of the AI platform.
  • Work with a large (internal), global team of Data Scientists, assembled from leading businesses and top academic institutions.


What will you need?


  • Relevant, commercial experience, taking business problems and delivering PoC's that are driven by machine learning.
  • Excellent academic history - PhD, Masters in a quantitative discipline. Bachelors will be considered, depending on what you have done in industry.
  • Proven experience in handling large scale end to end data science projects and presenting the findings and insights. Building models but also delivering a real solution that created a measurable impact.
  • Experience with Machine/Deep Learning techniques. Supervised, unsupervised or traditional; you need to know theory and practice (scikit-learn, keras or weka\xa0are good places to start)
  • Programming skills that allow you to be self-sufficient in handling data. Python and R are our daily companions, and a solid grasp of SQL is always needed. Big bonus points if you know Scala
  • Also welcome: Experience with large datasets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop, Spark)
  • Willingness to travel. Each person's work-life balance is considered carefully, but on-site support and guidance is necessary.\xa0


Why this opportunity?


Work on a cutting-edge, AI platform, that is rapidly changing how banks, insurers, governments, hospitals, charities, ecommerce unicorns, oil conglomerates (and many, many more) understand and react to their data.

Work with award-winning Data Scientists, Engineers and thought-leaders that come from a host of top-tier companies and academic institutions.

Choose your projects and where you want to leave a mark.

Have the opportunity for pro bono engagements, helping NGO's that are working on causes that you care about.

Be part of an organisation that develops and invests in its people and believes in helping them to get to where they want to be.


Big Cloud is a Machine Learning recruiting firm. We’re lucky enough to recruit the best candidates into the most exciting companies all over the world.

\xa0

We try to reply to all unsuccessful applications, but we’re human (for now). \xa0

\xa0

Check out www.bigcloud.io/hotjobs to see what else we're recruiting for

[

Senior Software Engineer - Cloud

Company Name Flexera Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 35 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Flexera is a company on the move with bold and ambitious plans. We are leading the transformation of an entire industry – reimagining the way software is bought, sold, managed and secured.


We are a unique company. We have a strong and deep history with over 20 years in the software industry. We are the company that built InstallShield, the installation technology you use every time you click “Next Next Next” to install something on your PC. We have the energy and mindset you might find in a start-up – taking initiative, disrupting, using lean principles, having a learning culture.


Currently, we are undergoing a significant transformation of our largest and primary product – FlexNet Manager Suite, and are looking for a talented Cloud-experienced engineer to join us for that mission.


We are seeking someone with expensive experience working on a SaaS/Cloud product with a micro-services architecture, in a DevOps culture, with a strong CICD approach.


The role involves:


  • Development of new product features, through the full life-cycle including requirements, technical design, automation, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Helping refactor a product to a micro-services architecture
  • Establishing and enhancing CICD pipelines
  • Enabling existing and new product features to run from the cloud
  • Object-oriented design and analysis
  • Collaboration with other teams
  • Investigation, debugging and resolution of customer issues


To be successful the senior engineer will need to have some (if not all) of the following attributes:


  • Deeply experienced in the .NET technology stack
  • An authority in best practice in multiple major programming languages, data-access services and scripting
  • Expertise in highly available, scalable and secure data architecture on both relational and non-relational technologies
  • A proven and respected engineer experienced in the architecture and delivery of successful applications at impressive scale
  • Previous experience of the implementation of data services in a virtualized or cloud environment
  • Sound understanding of cloud computing principles including security, high-availability and automation - an authoritative of Amazon Web Services’ management components will be a distinct advantage
  • Experienced with modern SCM for various types of development life cycle
  • An understanding of containerisation and microservices architecture


The following personal qualities are desired:


  • Passionate about self-learning and active in the (local or online) tech community
  • Highly motivated and relentless in solving problems
  • Prepared to go the extra mile when the team is up against it
  • Achieves the right balance of confidence and respect
  • Exemplifies leadership and challenges the status-quo when necessary


We are a highly agile team with a wonderful culture and work environment. If you love technology, love working with people, and have a desire to work on a market-leading product that needs to solve complex problems, we’d love to talk to you.


Reimagining the way Software is Bought, Sold, Managed and Secured
